text: Reflexive pronouns in Ewe are formed with ɖókui combined with the possessive pronoun; forms vary by person and number.
Plural reflexive forms place the possessive pronoun before ɖókui, while singular first and second person forms use suffixation.
When the possessive pronoun is suffixed to ɖókui in first and second singular, the tonal structure of ɖókui inverts (high↔low) as described in the lesson.
translation: Suffixed singular reflexives show tonal inversion of ɖókui (high and low tones swap).
